---
title: "Example Exam Using examadditions Class"
format: 
  examClass-pdf:
    keep-tex: true
---

% This example demonstrates the features of the examadditions class, which extends the exam class.

% Set up the exam environment
\checkboxchar{$\Box$}
\checkedchar{$\blacksquare$}
\addpoints

% Uncomment the following line to show answers
% \printanswers

% Custom question format with conditional title
\qformat{%
  \textbf{\thequestion.}%
  \textit{ \conditionalQuestionTitle}\hfill (\totalpoints\ points)
}

% Set up page style with header and footer
\pagestyle{headandfoot}
\footer{}{Page \thepage\ of \pageref*{LastPage}}{}

% Add a grading table
\gradetable[v][questions]

% Conditional content based on whether answers are being printed
\ifprintanswers
  \textbf{Instructor Version (with answers)}
\else
  \begin{center}
  \textbf{Student Exam}
  
  Instructions: Answer all questions. Show your work where applicable.
  \end{center}
\fi

\vspace{0.5cm}

\begin{questions}

\question[5] This is a standard question without a title.

\begin{parts}
\part[2] This is a part of the question.
\part[3] This is another part.
\end{parts}

\titledquestion{True/False Section}[10]

The following are true/false questions. The `true_false_questions` environment creates a formatted table.

\begin{true_false_questions}[Statement]
\tfitem{The Earth is flat.}{F}
\tfitem{Water boils at 100Â°C at sea level.}{T}
\tfitem{The Moon is made of cheese.}{F}
\end{true_false_questions}

\titledquestion{Multiple Choice}[5]

This question demonstrates the `multicolcheckboxes` environment, which creates a two-column layout for choices.

\begin{multicolcheckboxes}
\choice This is an incorrect choice
\CorrectChoice This is the correct choice
\choice Another incorrect choice
\choice Yet another incorrect choice
\end{multicolcheckboxes}

\question This question demonstrates subparts and subsubparts.

\begin{parts}
\part[3] This is a part with subparts.
  \begin{subparts}
  \subpart[1] This is a subpart.
  \subpart[2] This is another subpart with subsubparts.
    \begin{subsubparts}
    \subsubpart[1] This is a subsubpart.
    \subsubpart[1] This is another subsubpart.
    \end{subsubparts}
  \end{subparts}
\end{parts}

\titledquestion{Markdown and LaTeX Integration}[5]

This question demonstrates how you can use Markdown and LaTeX together:

1. You can use **bold** and *italic* text.
2. You can include inline math: $E = mc^2$
3. You can include display math:

   $$\int_{0}^{\infty} e^{-x^2} dx = \frac{\sqrt{\pi}}{2}$$

4. You can include code blocks:

   ```python
   def hello_world():
       print("Hello, World!")
   ```

5. You can include images and tables using standard Markdown syntax.

\question[5] Fill-in-the-blank question

\fillin[Newton]{_______________} discovered the laws of motion and universal gravitation.

\end{questions}

\pointtable[h][questions]
